Git Setup and GitHub Integration Guide
======================================

1. Git Setup
------------

Before using Git, configure your identity so your commits are properly labeled.

Steps:

1. Open Command Prompt (CMD):  
   - Press Win + R, type cmd, and press Enter.

2. Set your Git username:  
   git config --global user.name "Your Name"  
   (Replace "Your Name" with your actual name.)

3. Set your Git email:  
   git config --global user.email yourname@example.com  
   (Replace yourname@example.com with your email address, matching your GitHub email.)

---

2. SSH Key Creation
-------------------

SSH keys allow secure, passwordless connections to GitHub.

Steps:

1. Open Command Prompt (CMD):  
   - Press Win + R, type cmd, and press Enter.

2. Generate a new SSH key:  
   ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C "your_email@example.com"  
   (Replace "your_email@example.com" with your GitHub email.)  
   - Press Enter to accept the default file location.  
   - Optionally, set a passphrase for extra security.

3. Locate your SSH key:  
   - Go to: C:\\Users\\<YourUsername>\\.ssh  
   - Find the file named id_rsa.pub.

4. Copy your SSH public key:  
   - Open id_rsa.pub with Notepad.  
   - Copy all the text.

5. Add your SSH key to GitHub:  
   - Go to https://github.com  
   - Click your profile picture â†’ Settings  
   - Click SSH and GPG keys in the sidebar  
   - Click New SSH key  
   - Enter a title (e.g., "My Laptop SSH Key")  
   - Paste your SSH key into the "Key" field  
   - Click Add SSH key

---

3. Adding a GitHub Project in VS Code
-------------------------------------

Clone a GitHub repository into VS Code using SSH.

Steps:

1. Get the SSH URL of your repository:  
   - Go to your repository on GitHub  
   - Click the green Code button  
   - Select SSH and copy the SSH URL (e.g., git@github.com:username/repo.git)

2. Open Visual Studio Code.

3. Clone the repository:  
   - Press Ctrl + Shift + P to open the Command Palette  
   - Type Git: Clone and select it  
   - Paste the SSH URL and press Enter  
   - Choose a folder to save the project

4. Open the project:  
   - After cloning, VS Code will prompt you to open the repository. Click Open
